newsitem.title: USA: NY/NJ Port Authority Board okays bond, note sales.
newsitem.headline: NY/NJ Port Authority Board okays bond, note sales.

text.p: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Board on Thursday said it approved up to $4.5 billion of bond sales and up to $1 billion of note sales for 1997.
The bi-state agency, which oversees three major airports and a network of tunnels and bridges, said the bond and note sale proceeds would be used for capital programs and refundings.
The bond sales would be sold in 15 series, with each series totaling up to $300 million. And the notes would be sold in five series, each totaling up to $200 million.
The board also approved the authority's annual commercial paper program.
